text: Below is a list of players who have won multiple FIFA Women's World Cups. ==List== If the year is indicated in bold, it means the player appeared in the final match. If the year is indicated in italics, it means the player did not play a single minute in the finals tournament. ; *Michelle Akers \- 1991, 1999 *Brandi Chastain \- 1991, 1999 *Joy Fawcetthttp://m.mlssoccer.com/news/article/agoos-fawcett-elected-hall-fame \- 1991, 1999 *Julie Foudy \- 1991, 1999 *Mia Hamm \- 1991, 1999 *Kristine Lilly \- 1991, 1999 *Carla Overbeck \- 1991, 1999 *Christie Rampone \- 1999, 2015 *Morgan Brian - 2015, 2019 *Julie Ertz - 2015, 2019 *Ashlyn Harris - 2015, 2019 *Tobin Heath - 2015, 2019 *Ali Krieger - 2015, 2019 *Carli Lloyd - 2015, 2019 *Alex Morgan - 2015, 2019 *Alyssa Naeher - 2015, 2019 *Kelley O'Hara - 2015, 2019 *Christen Press - 2015, 2019 *Megan Rapinoe - 2015, 2019 *Becky Sauerbrunn - 2015, 2019 ; *Nadine Angerer \- 2003, 2007 *Linda Bresonik \- 2003, 2007 *Sonja Fuss \- 2003, 2007 *Kerstin Garefrekeshttp://www.sportsnetwork.com/merge/tsnform.aspx?c=kentucky2&page;=soc- wwc/news/news.aspx?id=486097 \- 2003, 2007 *Ariane Hingst \- 2003, 2007 *Renate Lingor \- 2003, 2007 *Sandra Minnert \- 2003, 2007 *Martina Müller \- 2003, 2007 *Birgit Prinz \- 2003, 2007 *Silke Rottenberg \- 2003, 2007 *Sandra Smisek \- 2003, 2007 *Kerstin Stegemann \- 2003, 2007 ==Notes== *No player has won two World Cups both as captain. Carla Overbeck (1999), Birgit Prinz (2007) and Christie Rampone (2015) lifted the trophy once as captain, but were not captain for the other tournament. ==References== Mul Category:FIFA Women's World Cup-related lists Category:Association football player non-biographical articles
title: List of players who have won multiple FIFA Women's World Cups
